page.title: 05HALE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: THE VILLAGE HALL WAS BUILT IN 1931 TO PROVIDE SOCIAL, EDUCATIONAL AND REC- REATIONAL FACILITIES FOR THE PEOPLE OF HALE AND DISTRICT. IT IS REGISTER- ED AS A CHARITY. HALE PLAYGROUP, WHICH CATERS FOR CHILDREN UNDER FIVE, USES THE HALL ON MOST MORNINGS OF THE WEEK AND THE PRIMARY SCHOOL USES IT FOR PHYSICAL EDUCATION. ALSO USING THE HALL ON A REGULAR BASIS ARE THE KEEP_FIT CLUB, THE CRICKET CLUB, THE WOMAN'S INSTITUTE, THE HORTICULTURAL SOCIETY, THE KUNG- FU CLUB AND THE WINE CIRCLE. THE TOTAL INCOME FOR 1984 WAS APPROX- IMATELY Â£3000, BUT THIS WILL BE LOWER IN 1985. DISCOS, WHICH IN 1982 BROUGHT IN ABOUT Â£1500, ARE NO LONGER POPULAR, AND SUPPORT FOR WHIST DRIVES IS ALSO DECLINING.
